item_title: CALL TO ORDER, ROLL CALL & TRIBAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT.

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Application No. 1-23-0289 (Kinder, King Salmon)
subitem_blurb: Application of Johnny & Nancy Kinder to remodel and add 364 sq.ft. to 1,313 sq. ft., 2-story, single-family home, resulting in 1,676 sq. ft., 2-story, single-family home with 212 sq. ft. second-story deck and replace 410 sq. ft. detached garage at 1755 Buhne Drive in the unincorporated community of King Salmon, 1.5 miles south of Eureka, Humboldt County. (CM-A)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s San Francisco office at (415) 904-5260.

subitem_title: Application No. 2-23-0662 (Pasarell SFD, Seadrift)
subitem_blurb: Application by Cleve Pasarell to remodel interior of 2,927 sq.ft. single-family home; convert 1,025 sq.ft. of exterior paved area to planted landscape; and replace outdoor steps, patio, and deck, at 59 Dipsea Road, within private Seadrift community just upcoast of unincorporated Stinson Beach area of Marin County. (LH-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 2-22-0664 (Johnson Pier Expansion and Replacement, San Mateo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by San Mateo County Harbor District to repair and expand pier head; replace fuel dock and several floating docks; and construct new working dock at Johnson Pier in Pillar Point Harbor in unincorporated San Mateo County. (IC-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-23-0006-1 Part B (Objective Design Standards and Code Cleanup).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Santa Cruz to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to establish objective design standards for multifamily dwellings and mixed-use residential development and conduct minor zoning code cleanup. (KF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

item_title: Items W16a and W16b below will share a combined staff report and combined hearing.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-SLO-23-0027 (Bergen SFD Addition, Cambria)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Christine Heinrichs and Elizabeth Bettenhausen from San Luis Obispo County decision granting permit with conditions to Terry Bergen for conversion of 154-sq.ft. attached storage room into bedroom and 51-sq.ft. laundry room into bathroom, new 290-sq.ft. outdoor patio, and other interior improvements to 1,673-sq.ft. home, at 2587 Romney Drive in the unincorporated community of Cambria in San Luis Obispo County. (DJ-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-SLO-23-0028 (Lucero-Sokol SFD Addition, Cambria)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Christine Heinrichs and Elizabeth Bettenhausen from San Luis Obispo County decision granting permit with conditions to Anthony Lucero and Kimberly Sokol for conversion of 500-sq.ft. detached garage into 600-sq.ft. detached guesthouse with attached 210-sq.ft. single-car garage to 2,397-sq.ft. home, at 1875 Chester Lane in the unincorporated community of Cambria in San Luis Obispo County. (DJ-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-PGR-23-0038 (Wastewater Collection System Repairs, Pacific Grove)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Anthony A. Ciani from City of Pacific Grove decision granting permit to repair and improve three segments of the City’s wastewater collection system. (BA-SC)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-3-SCO-23-0042 (Tzouanakis-Ajao Seawall, Santa Cruz County)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Commissioners Hart and Escalante from Santa Cruz County decision granting permit with conditions to Emily Tzouanakis and Adeyemi Ajao for seawall augmentation, including addition of concrete slurry to fill void space extending the seawall inland and upcoast, and addition of a new seawall foundation extending the seawall below and seaward of its existing location, at the toe of the bluff and on sandy beach fronting 4790 Opal Cliff Drive in the unincorporated Live Oak area of Santa Cruz County. (NC-SC)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0271 (Day, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Tom Day to remove 680 sq.ft. floating dock and install new 648 sq.ft. floating dock and replace 3-ft. x 22-ft. gangway with new 3-ft. x 24-ft. gangway.  In addition, relocate one 14-in. square pile, but two existing 14-in. square piles will remain in place, at 52 Linda Isle, Newport Beach. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0971 (Christovich, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Steve and Susan Christovich to demolish two detached residential units (1,210 sq.ft. and 616 sq.ft.) and a detached 813 sq.ft. two-car garage and construct 25 ft. high, 3,297 sq.ft. two-story single-family home with 832 sq.ft. 2nd floor ADU and attached 813 sq.ft. three-car garage, at 233/235 7th Street, Seal Beach, Orange County.  (FSY-LB)

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.

item_title: Please note: Items Th9c & Th10a share a single combined staff report and hearing.

subitem_title: Application 9-23-0785 (South Coast Water District, Orange Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of South Coast Water District to conduct geotechnical testing and install two monitoring wells to identify subsurface hydrogeologic conditions in support of preparing final designs for slant wells to be used by the District's Doheny desalination facility, at Doheny State Beach, Orange County. (TL-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 9-20-0488 (Nordic Aquafarms California, LLC, Samoa)
subitem_blurb: Application by Nordic Aquafarms California, LLC, to discharge up to 10.3 million gallons per day of tertiary-treated wastewater from its yellowtail farming facility via existing Redwood Marine Terminal II ocean-outfall pipe, 1.5 miles offshore Samoa, Humboldt County.

subitem_title: Application No. 9-23-0548 (Seren Juno Network America, Inc., Grover Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Seren Juno Network America, Inc. to install and operate one submarine fiber optic cable extending from one of four existing landing pipes in Gover Beach through state and federal waters and terminating in Japan. The project would also install and operate one ocean ground bed system located below ground within the gravel parking lot for Pismo State Beach. (WH-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Consistency Certification No. CC-0002-23 (Seren Juno Network America, Inc., Grover Beach)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Certification by Seren Juno Network America, Inc. to install and operate one submarine fiber optic cable extending from one of four existing landing pipes in Grover Beach through state and federal waters and terminating in Japan. The project would also install and operate one ocean ground bed system located below ground within the gravel parking lot for Pismo State Beach. (WH-SF)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: CD-0006-20 (National Park Service, Marin Co.)
subitem_blurb: Annual informational briefing on the progress made on implementation of the 2022 Point Reyes National Seashore (PRNS) Water Quality Strategy - developed by National Park Service (NPS) as specified in Conditions I and IV of the Coastal Commission’s conditional concurrence on Consistency Determination No. CD-0006-20 for the 2020 General Management Plan Amendment for PRNS and the North District of Golden Gate National Recreation Area. (AB-SF) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this site.)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-23-0033-2
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Laguna Beach to amend the Land Use Plan land use designation map and the Implementation Plan zoning map to change the land use designations at 26 city owned parcels from Residential/Hillside Protection to Permanent Open Space; and to change the zoning at the same 26 parcels from Residential/Hillside Protection to Open Space/Passive. Twenty-two of the 26 parcels are located on the eastern slope of Laguna Canyon, the remaining four parcels are also located in undeveloped hillside area, southeast of the other 22 parcels, in City of Laguna Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Laguna Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-LGB-23-0038-3. Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the City of Laguna Beach request to amend the Implementation Plan of the certified Local Coastal Program, including the addition of a permanent ordinance related to Single-Family Residential One- and Two Unit Developments and Urban Lot Splits pursuant to Senate Bill 9 within specified single-family residential zones (Chapter 25.95)., in City of Laguna Beach, Orange County. (KT-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0804 (Surf City Partners, LLC, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Surf City Partners, LLC to convert former bait, tackle, and sundries shop on Huntington Beach pier to restaurant;  project includes additions to existing building that formerly housed bait, tackle and sundries shop as well as to public restroom building. The project will result in 1,248 sq. ft. of encroachment into public pier area, inlcuding the proposed placement of three, 32 sq. ft. carts on pier, at 21 and 22 Main St. (located on the pier), in Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0120 (Gage Village Residential Development LLC, Sunset Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Gage Village Residential Development LLC to demolish two-story four-plex with three (3) one-car garages and construct new 3-story, 35-ft. tall, detached duplex. Each unit will be 2,642 sq.ft. and will include roof deck and 2-car garage, at 16811 14th Street, Sunset Beach, Orange County. (KT-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0293 (Maximo Diamond, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application by Maximo Diamond to remove 11.5-ft. high, 1,000 sq. ft. manufactured home and detached 120 sq.ft. Storage shed, and install new approx. 14-ft. high, approx. 1,500 sq.ft. manufactured home with new detached 120 sq.ft. storage shed on existing 3,074 sq.ft. mobile home lot (Space K-44) within Laguna Terrace Mobile Home Park, at 30802 South Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (MR-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0397 (City of San Clemente, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of San Clemente to install nine 30-in. diameter caissons to provide stabilization for sewer lift station that was damaged by landslide in Fall of 2021.  Proposed project also involves replacement of approximately 217 linear ft. of damaged storm drain pipelines within existing alignment and easement, repair of generator slab and steps leading to sewer lift station electrical room, replacement of approximately 2,000 linear ft. of 6-in. sewer force main pipe with new 6-in. PVC pipe, minor surfacing and repairs to vehicular access road, as well as remove asphalt from portions of road that have dropped below grade and plant 2,071 sq.ft. of native vegetation in its place near Cyprus Shore Community Building west of Avenida De Las Palmera and Calle Ariana intersection, San Clemente, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-23-0349 (Bigelow, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Gail and Matt Bigelow to demolish a 12 ft. tall, one-story, 1,050 sq.ft. single-family home with attached garage and construct 29 ft. tall, three-story, 2,499 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 461 sq.ft. garage, on a 2,402 sq. ft. lot. at 726 Jersey Court, Mission Beach, San Diego, San Diego County. subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-DMR-22-0020 (Watermark DM, L.P., Del Mar)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Del Mar Hillside Community Association and Jill Schulz from decision of City of Del Mar granting permit with conditions to Watermark DM, L.P., to remove dirt parking lot and construct new 4-story, 48-ft. high, 132,894 sq. ft. 50-unit multi-family residential development over parking garage including 10 affordable units on 2.37-acre site; consolidate 2 lots into 1, at southeast corner of Jimmy Durante Boulevard and San Dieguito Drive, Del Mar, San Diego County. (SL-SD)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-6-ENC-23-0024 (Beacon’s Beach Parking Lot, Encinitas)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by John Wigmore, Michael Conway, and Matthew Gordon from decision of City of Encinitas granting permit with conditions to City of Encinitas to remove existing 26-stall public parking lot and blufftop sidewalk and replace with 15-stall parking lot and sidewalk located approximately 10 feet further inland at 948 Neptune Ave., Encinitas, San Diego County. (JP-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-23-0186 (Barlow Capital Investment, LLC, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of Barlow Capital Investment, LLC, to remove debris from beach, install approx. 25 ft. x 25-ft. erodible concrete wall, and remove unpermitted gunite on bluff face below existing blufftop single family home, at 5386 Calumet Ave, La Jolla, San Diego, San Diego County (AL-SD) (Note: The Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_blurb: Appeal by Dominique Lacerte (Lacerte Family Trust) from County of Santa Barbara decision granting permit to BMO, LLC (Robert Mecay) for construction of 795 sq.ft. second story attached accessory dwelling unit with 142 sq.ft. deck to existing 1,638 sq. ft., single-story, single-family home at 2305 Finney Street, Summerland, Santa Barbara County. (SF-V)

subitem_title: City of Redondo Beach LCP Amendment No. LCP-5-RDB-23-0036-1
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Redondo Beach to amend the Implementation Plan (IP) portion of the certified Local Coastal Program (LCP) for modification of residential accessory structural setback requirements is de minimis. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-DRL-23-0039 (Campbell, Playa Del Rey)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Beverley King from decision of City of Los Angeles Department of City Planning approving  permit to John Campbell for remodel and addition to existing 2,196 sq. ft. approximately 32 ft. high three-story single-family home including 959 sq.ft. addition and new fourth floor, new 367 sq.ft. rooftop deck, and conversion of 733 sq.ft. of first floor into new Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU); resulting in 37 ft. high four-story, 3,155 sq. ft. single-family home with attached ADU and no change to parking at 6509 Vista Del Mar, Playa Del Rey, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (JP-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0193 (SoCalGas, Playa Del Rey)
subitem_blurb: Application of Southern California Gas Company (SoCalGas) to construct approximately 244-ft. long colored and textured retaining wall, ranging in height from 4ft. to 7ft.  Proposed wall will be constructed using soldier pile and lagging system design intended to stabilize toe of existing slope at 8141 South Gulana Avenue, Playa Del Rey, Los Angeles County. (EG-LB)
